alert.note: Alert for Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Oldham County through 600 PM CDT... At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northwest of Adrian, or 18 miles southeast of Nara Visa, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Oldham County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
